page.title: 05Landscape and Buildings
page.content: {Landscape and Buildings Whilst Flockton Parish church is not important architectually, it has one important feature, the William Morris Window. People interested in stained glass and/or in William Morris have found the Parish church to be worth a visit. Netherton Hall is a fine eighreenth century stucture and is probably the third hall on the present site. Although now divided into three residences there are a number of interesting features including an oak panelled room with a reputedly Adam fireplace, wooden ledges for storing wines and beer in the cellars, and a room at the bottom of the cellar steps for imprisoning poachers. There was a secret tunnel and the house reputedly has a ghost, a lady in a grey dress.
